formal_accuser.name: Royne femme Demenge Marchal
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: Village resident who alleged night visitation

confession.seduction_context: Two women, one being Mayelle femme Hermanns Hanns, told her they had found 'ung beau jeune homme' and she should believe in him and do as he said. She had lost several horses and wanted to know why to avoid similar troubles in future. Met him behind a house.
powder_types: powder from stillborn child (fetched from cemetery at Albestroff on a distaff)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Rent payable for a barn they shared, with 32 francs at issue
testimony.threat_quote: He called her 'bastarde', and she cursed him

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: sickened soon after, died in 6 months

testimony.quarrel_subject: Summoned her son to guard fort at Dieuze while ditches were being cleaned

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: fell ill for 8 weeks as soon as he reached house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrelling with Petter Stürlen over an inheritance - said he and his wife were both witches
At a childbed, accused quarrelled with Geyss Salonné

harms_alleged.target: Messire Jacques Guedmon, curé of Bisping
harms_alleged.harm_description: Became feverish, then had to take to his bed with a swollen leg; finally died, still maintaining that Synelle had given him the illness

testimony.quarrel_subject: Synnelle (daughter of accused) asked if she could ride one of the horses back; he told her to walk

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Senelle femme Waisen Petter (via her daughter)
harms_alleged.harm_description: Both his knees became painful, remained so for 3 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: She asked his wife to sell her some 'leavette' to make cheese; although she feared her, wife eventually sold some

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: That evening a cow sickened and died following night

harms_alleged.harm_description: Great losses they were experiencing with their horses

harms_alleged.target_relationship: lived in house of Pierron Dommeré
harms_alleged.harm_description: Sickened and died; during long illness told witness and others that Synnelle had given her the sickness

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband of accused refused to attach horses for fish transport job, saying if they did not send better ones he would do the job himself
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle avoit veu aultrefois perdre ung meilleur bien que le leur, et qu'elle poulroit encor bien veoir aultant en arriver a leur endroit

harms_alleged.harm_description: Mare which had a swelling on its leg suddenly began to decline, and died in 3 days

harms_alleged.target: premature child of Georgeatte femme Pierron Domeré
harms_alleged.target_relationship: in house where witness was called
harms_alleged.harm_description: Georgeatte felt unwell at table, gave birth prematurely at midnight, child was dead. Next day told witness that Synelle had come to her bedside and pulled her big toe, causing distress and child to die of fright

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute with her husband when taking 'ellevin' from étang de Lindre; they fought when latter tried to take away his cauldron
testimony.threat_quote: She said he should watch out

harms_alleged.harm_description: Horse fell ill within 3 days, died after 3 months
Mare became ill and died same night

Wife immediately felt pain in stomach (she was about a month pregnant) after receiving bread from Senelle. She later aborted, and died after being ill at least 3 months. After receiving sacraments told him she thought Synnel had made her ill, and that she had seen her by her bed

testimony.quarrel_subject: Same as husband - asked to sell 'leavette' to make cheese

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: That evening cow sickened and died following night

testimony.quarrel_subject: Asked Synelle to be godmother to her child; when Synelle visited, witness had another child on her knee. Synelle asked why she put up with this and should put child down; witness replied she should leave it alone

harms_alleged.harm_description: Next night child sickened and died in 3 days

testimony.quarrel_subject: Came to house asking to buy some flax, which witness refused saying she had too many children. One child embraced her saying 'voicy ma tante'; she replied 'je suis une belle tante je ne te donne rien'

harms_alleged.harm_description: 2 or 3 days later child had neck twisted. Synelle rubbed neck saying child would be well; neck recovered but child lost use of limbs and was unlikely to recover this

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over some money she owed husband of witness

harms_alleged.harm_description: Around previous Christmas woke in night to find Synelle kneeling over her husband in bed - room was lit by blue candle. He was so deeply asleep that pushing and pinching had no effect, then Synelle looked at her and she was unable to speak. Heard catch of kitchen door, opened eyes and light had gone out
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: a year before, around previous Christmas

timeline.subject: Royne femme Demenge Marchal
timeline.details: Substitut for PG associates himself with Royne femme Demenge Marchal. She had alleged night visitation by Senelle. Senelle had sought reparation, but Royne refused, saying there was sufficient proof that she was a witch

timeline.subject: Senelle femme Waisen Petter
timeline.details: Rémy asks for arrest, interrogation, and confrontations

timeline.subject: Senelle femme Waisen Petter
timeline.details: First interrogation - she denied most charges, offered some alternative explanations

timeline.subject: Senelle femme Waisen Petter
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - she admitted some circumstantial details while denying causing harm

timeline.subject: Senelle femme Waisen Petter
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - lifted by rope with toes still touching ground. No confession, sent back to prison overnight

timeline.subject: Senelle femme Waisen Petter
timeline.details: Further interrogation - executioner called to place her on rack, but she offered to confess before being placed on it. Confessed to seduction by Federbusch 7 years earlier, making hail, causing deaths, sabbat activities

timeline.subject: Senelle femme Waisen Petter
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

methods: strappado (lifted by rope with toes touching ground)
threat of rack (executioner called to place her on rack, confessed before being racked)

accomplices_named.name: Mayelle femme Hermanns Hanns
accomplices_named.context: One of two women who introduced her to Federbusch 7 years earlier; also participated in causing Georgeatte femme Pierron Domeré to abort by holding her big toe

accomplices_named.name: Ennel fillate Faulhanns
accomplices_named.context: Met under the elm where court sat about 18 months before; told to go by night to blacksmith's house and kill him with a drink

accomplices_named.name: femme Conradt
accomplices_named.context: Met under the elm where court sat about 18 months before; told to go by night to blacksmith's house and kill him with a drink

accomplices_named.name: Barbe femme Stophle
accomplices_named.context: Met under the elm where court sat about 18 months before; told to go by night to blacksmith's house and kill him with a drink. Had a grievance against the blacksmith

accomplices_named.name: Alizon femme Hanns Becker
accomplices_named.context: Met under the elm where court sat about 18 months before; told to go by night to blacksmith's house and kill him with a drink

accomplices_named.name: Woman of Guermange
accomplices_named.context: Told Eve femme Grand Bauer about how devil could take clothes left on bench with 4 legs

prior_accusations.context: 14 years before at a childbed quarrelled with accused, told her she was a perfect witch
When quarrelling with Petter Stürlen over an inheritance said he and his wife were both witches

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle to Geyss Salonné
notable_quotes.french: sy une sorciere se fut teü ce jourd'huy l'on n'en eust point ouÿ parler
notable_quotes.context: Response after being called a perfect witch at a childbed 14 years before

notable_quotes.speaker: Messire Jacques Guedmon, curé of Bisping
notable_quotes.french: O dieu qu'ay je faict, je ne me suis point signé ce matin et aye mauvaise oppinion sur ladicte Synnelle, pour ce que j'ay assisté audit Steff, pour luy faire avoir ladicte fille
notable_quotes.context: On return from marriage journey, before becoming ill with swollen leg and dying

notable_quotes.speaker: Travelling tailor to Senelle
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle mesme le sçavoit bien, et que ce faisoit elle mesme
notable_quotes.context: When she asked him as if he were a devin what could be the cause of great losses with horses

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle to mother of Doctor Nickel
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit veu aultrefois perdre ung meilleur bien que le leur, et qu'elle poulroit encor bien veoir aultant en arriver a leur endroit
notable_quotes.context: Quarrelling during husband's absence about fish transport job

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle to wife of Pierron Jean Dommeré
notable_quotes.french: que son mary estoit ung grand seigneur et qu'il charroyoit seul, mais qu'il n'y charroyeroit guiere
notable_quotes.context: During absence when horses were sent back for elver transport

notable_quotes.speaker: Child to Senelle
notable_quotes.context: When Senelle came to buy flax

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle to child
notable_quotes.french: je suis une belle tante je ne te donne rien
notable_quotes.context: Response to child calling her aunt

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle (cursing her brother Faulhanns)
notable_quotes.french: le diable luy puisse rompre le col
notable_quotes.context: After dispute over money owed for inherited house and barn

relationships.evidence_text: Said he was her 'frere germain' (full brother)
Barbe femme Faulhanns - her late husband Faulhanns
Had summoned her son to guard fort at Dieuze
Beckerhanns and his wife; Alizon femme Beckerhanns
She had asked Synelle to be godmother to her child

economic_context.details: Major dispute with her brother Faulhanns over inheritance - he owed her 16 florins for a house and barn they had inherited jointly. She had helped him with building work but he would not pay. She caused him trouble and he cited her before justice. Dispute over rent payable for a barn they shared (32 francs at issue). Multiple disputes over labor/services (fish transport, horse sharing for cart work).

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Rent dispute over shared barn with 32 francs at issue; he called her 'bastarde'
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: soon after quarrel, died in 6 months

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Summoned her son to guard fort at Dieuze
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: as soon as he reached house

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Curé had accompanied Steffen Faulhanns to seek marriage; Senelle was seen looking over her door at them as they passed

harms_catalog.harm_description: Both his knees became painful; remained so for 3 weeks until pilgrimage to Beau Bernard made on his behalf

Asked wife to sell 'leavette' to make cheese; although wife feared her, eventually sold some

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Women were choosing a midwife; Georgeatte joined them at tavern
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: same day - felt unwell at table, gave birth at midnight

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horse fell ill within 3 days, died after 3 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with her husband when taking 'ellevin' from étang de Lindre; they fought when he tried to take away cauldron. She quarrelled with witness saying he should watch out

harms_catalog.harm_description: Mare became ill and died same night
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He had bad leg, sent boy to ask Waysenpetter to do elver transport. Husband refused but sent 3 horses; witness sent them back. During absence Synelle told his wife her husband was a great lord who transported alone but would not do so much longer
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: on return, mare died same night

harms_catalog.harm_description: Immediately felt pain in stomach (she was about a month pregnant) after receiving bread payment. Later aborted and died after being ill at least 3 months. After receiving sacraments told him she thought Synnel had made her ill and had seen her by her bed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He told Senelle her old cow had been left behind when he was cattle herdsman

harms_catalog.harm_description: Next night child sickened and died in 3 days

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over some money she owed husband of witness

harms_catalog.harm_description: Around previous Christmas woke in night to find Synelle kneeling over husband in bed with blue candle. He was so deeply asleep that pushing and pinching had no effect. When Synelle looked at witness she was unable to speak. Heard catch of kitchen door, light went out
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: a year before, around previous Christmas
harms_catalog.method_alleged: night visitation, blue candle, kneeling on victim, supernatural sleep

material_culture.context: Shared barn over which rent dispute occurred with brother (32 francs at issue)
House and barn inherited jointly with brother (owed 16 florins)
Senelle seen kneeling over Royne's husband with candle with strong blue flame
Substance used to make cheese, which Beckerhanns's wife sold to Senelle
Used for taking elvers from pond; subject of fight with Pierron Domeré's husband
Multiple horses owned and lost by various parties; used for transport and farm work; subject of many disputes
Barbe femme Steffen Faulhanns refused to sell flax to Senelle
Payment given by Senelle to wife of Pierron when he told her about her old cow; wife felt pain in stomach after receiving it
If clothes left on bench or chest with 4 legs at night, devil could come and take them so witches could wear them when doing ill
Bowl with which had been sewn the shroud of a dead body; if pushed into path where person or animal passed, they would become lame and die
Devil's money turned out to be pieces of pottery and horse-dung
Used to make poisoned drink to kill blacksmith; fetched from cemetery at Albestroff on a distaff
Used to fetch powder from stillborn child from cemetery
Senelle did not swallow host but kept them and finally threw them away
16 florins owed for house and barn; 32 francs at issue in rent dispute; money owed to Klein Nickel's husband

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused
Where maire Michiel summoned Senelle's son to guard fort while ditches were being cleaned; where Anthoine went with 2 horses
Home of executed woman who told about devil taking clothes from bench
Where plaids (court sessions) were held; where dispute with brother occurred; where accused met with accomplices about 18 months before trial
Curé and wedding party passed along walkway to avoid mud when Senelle looked at them
Pilgrimage site where Anthoine had pilgrimage made on his behalf to cure painful knees
Home of Laurent Hoch and Chrestophe Charpentier (witnesses)
Pond from which Pierron Jean Domeré was taking fish/elvers
Destination for fish transport from Gros Etang de Lindre
Where Pierron Jean Dommeré lived at time of testimony (8 km away from Bisping)
Where women went to eat and drink when choosing a midwife; where Georgeatte felt unwell
Where Senelle fetched powder from stillborn child on a distaff
Home of girl sought in marriage by Steffen Faulhanns
Home of boy who was in service of accused's household and told magical lore (now dead)

historical_context.military_details: 2 or 3 years before trial, soldiers (about 20) were in the village and were taking off 2 horses belonging to Senelle at night. Her devil promised to recover them, which he did.
weather_events: Senelle confessed to making hail in usual manner
economic_hardship_indicators: Multiple disputes over inheritance and property
Disputes over labor sharing and transport work
Loss of horses described as causing great economic hardship
Careful tracking of debts and payments
religious_calendar_references: Christmas (around previous Christmas when night visitation occurred)
Easter (Senelle kept communion hosts and threw them away instead of swallowing)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Brother Faulhanns owed her 16 florins for house and barn inherited jointly. She had helped him with building work but he would not pay. She caused him some trouble so he cited her before justice

Senelle had sought reparation from Royne femme Demenge Marchal for alleging she had seen her kneeling on her husband with a blue candle. Royne refused, saying there was sufficient proof she was a witch

legal_context.redress_outcome: Royne refused to provide reparation, saying there was sufficient proof Senelle was a witch. This led to the substitut for PG associating himself with Royne's accusation
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Sent back to prison overnight between torture sessions

hearsay_chains.content: Heard Pierron Domeré say she had killed his wife
During long illness Georgeatte told witness and others that Synnelle had given her the sickness
Georgeatte told witness that Synelle had come to her bedside and pulled her big toe causing child to die of fright
After receiving sacraments she told him she thought Synnel had made her ill and that she had seen her by her bed
Heard story of Senelle kneeling over Royne's husband with a candle from Royne as they were going to market
Neighbours told him that Senelle had cursed him

emotional_state_notes: More or less admitted circumstantial details while denying causing harm
Resisted torture initially - no confession when lifted by rope
Offered to confess when executioner was called to place her on rack (before being racked)

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said Pierron Domeré killed his own horses by beating them too much. Said horses died after working hard and she had lost them in this way
Denied involvement in death of curé - suggested her son had been unsuccessful suitor for the girl's hand (alternative explanation)
Said child had fallen off a dungheap (natural explanation for twisted neck)

third_parties.name: Faulhanns (brother)
third_parties.context: Died after dispute over inherited property; owed her 16 florins for house and barn

third_parties.name: Messire Jacques Guedmon, curé of Bisping
third_parties.context: Died with swollen leg after accompanying Steffen Faulhanns on marriage journey; maintained Synelle had given him illness

third_parties.name: Georgeatte femme Pierron Domeré
third_parties.context: Died during long illness claiming Synnelle had given her sickness; also lost premature child

third_parties.name: Geyss Salonné
third_parties.context: At a childbed quarrelled with accused; told her she was a perfect witch; accused replied they called each other witch

third_parties.name: Petter Stürlen
third_parties.context: When Eve quarrelling with him over inheritance, she said he and his wife were both witches

third_parties.name: Steffen Faulhanns
third_parties.context: Accompanied by curé when seeking marriage; asked curé to do him honour

third_parties.name: Daughter of Muttervillig
third_parties.context: Girl sought in marriage by Steffen Faulhanns; possibly unsuccessfully sought by Senelle's son

third_parties.name: Travelling tailor
third_parties.context: 15 years before was working for Laurent Hoch; Senelle asked him as if he were a devin about horse losses; he replied she knew the cause herself

third_parties.name: Pierron (father-in-law of Doctor Nickel)
third_parties.context: Lost mare after dispute over fish transport work

third_parties.name: Beggar-woman
third_parties.context: Told Senelle and 3 other women about devil taking clothes from bench with 4 legs; since executed

third_parties.name: Woman of Guermange
third_parties.context: Told Eve about devil taking clothes; since executed

third_parties.name: Boy of Fribourg
third_parties.context: Told about magical lore (bowl method to make enemies lame); now dead

third_parties.name: Blacksmith
third_parties.context: Target of planned poisoning plot 18 months before; Barbe femme Stophle had grievance against him

third_parties.name: Blacksmith's wife
third_parties.context: Eve thought she might have wrongly identified her after devil took her clothes

third_parties.name: Synnelle (daughter of accused)
third_parties.context: Asked Anthoine for ride on horse; her son may have been unsuccessful suitor

third_parties.name: Son of Senelle
third_parties.context: Summoned to guard fort; possibly unsuccessful suitor for marriage

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with extensive witness testimony, detailed confessions under torture threat, and comprehensive catalog of alleged harms. Trial shows pattern of property/economic disputes leading to accusations. Notable features include: night visitation with blue candle, accusations spanning 20 years, multiple animal deaths (especially horses), involvement in inheritance disputes with brother who died, devil named Federbusch, powder from stillborn child, plot to poison blacksmith, confession of making hail and causing abortion by pulling toe. Confession obtained under threat of rack (offered to confess when executioner called but before being placed on rack). Multiple accomplices named. Death sentence approved by Change de Nancy.
